Ingredients.3: 0.75 cup gluten-free baking flour (such as Premium Gold® Flax and Ancient Grains All-Purpose Flour)

Ingredients.4: 0.5 teaspoon garlic powder, or to taste

Ingredients.5: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.6: 2 heads  cauliflower, cut into bite-size pieces

Ingredients.8: 0.5 cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet with cooking spray.

Directions.2: Whisk together water, flour, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until batter is smooth and somewhat runny. Add cauliflower pieces to batter and mix until evenly coated; spread onto the prepared baking sheet.

Directions.3: Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 20 to 25 minutes. Set aside.

Directions.4: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat; stir in hot pepper sauce and honey until smooth. Brush hot sauce mixture over each cauliflower piece, repeating until all is used.

Directions.5: Return to the oven and bake until cauliflower is browned, about 10 minutes. Let cool for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.
